item.title: Data Scientist - Wireless Network Performance
item.description:
Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

There’s a lot of buzz around the next leaps in wireless network optimization, leveraging data science, big data and machine learning. Join a team that is re-thinking how we optimize our wireless network by blending wireless engineering, computational analysis, and programming. At TELUS, with over 9 million subscribers, there’s a lot of data being generated from our network, and with this lies untapped potential for data mining and advanced insights towards improving our customers’ wireless experience. 

 

As a Data Scientist and member of Eastern Canada\'s wireless network performance team, you\'ll play a critical role in the optimization of the Radio Access Network (RAN) by developing automation policies and algorithms, workflow and data processing services and finding new angles/methods to improve network performance, efficiently. You\'ll join the larger Wireless Networks & Services DevOps team that is providing TELUS customers with the most reliable network and the best user experience in every region of the country.

 

In our team, you\'ll ensure our customers\' wireless experience continuously improves. Your "think outside of the box" and innovation will help shape our Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that we use to govern our customers\' wireless experience. Your data science and automation mindset will provide inputs to our team to improve the quality and efficiency of the way we do network performance engineering.

What you’ll do

 

  • Use data to:
    • discover opportunities to improve our processes
    • enhance our decision-making ability
  • Explore data to:
    • design innovative predictive models and metrics
    • develop dashboards to uncover actionable insights
  • Lead the development, validation, and deployment of AI/ML models and bring these to production
  • You’ll be exposed to the latest wireless technology innovation planned for TELUS, and be ready to support their launch from a performance management perspective

What you bring

 

  • A passion for how data can be used to uncover new insights, solve problems and drive effective actions
  • A strategic thinking and a bias for action and driving change
  • Curious and creative in looking at metrics to identify new critical metrics for the team
  • Master visualizations and be able to explain complex topics to non-technical audiences
  • You value deploying Machine Learning and AI solutions for problems solving
  • You are a strong software developer, you regularly and primarily develop in Python
  • You are familiar with at least one of the cloud computing platforms - GCP, AWS, Azure
  • Minimum of 3+ years of working with large data sets and analyzing data to identify patterns and in writing and testing code proficiently

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Google Cloud Platform and tools knowledge
  • Bachelor degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent, or equivalent education and/or experience

item.title: Cloud Data Architect
item.description:
Description

 

About our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

The Predictive Analysis & Modelling team are focussed on customer demand and intents prediction in order to inform downstream planning processes and enable optimal service levels for our customers.

 

We are data scientists, developer analysts, and strategy managers who are leveraging the latest machine learning technologies to build and support the next generation of forecast models. The demand forecasts we create set the stage for budgeting and supply planning activities, future strategy, and performance of the business.

 

As a member of our team, you’ll will enjoy a flexible work style with the ability to work at home, in an innovative and collaborative environment. You’ll create and maintain data pipelines to support our machine learning models, develop dashboards to share insights and self-serve options, and play an integral role in the development and maturity of the data strategy within our team.

 

Here’s how

 

  • Developing, maintaining, and evolving our MLOps methodology
  • Maintain existing data pipelines that feed into our machine learning models 
  • Partner with Data Scientists to identify data requirements to bring models to production
  • Analyze and profile data, perform data wrangling and dimension reduction
  • Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve new batch data pipelines 
  • Empower team members by creating dashboards to enable self-serve options
  • Create opportunities for ongoing innovation by maintaining an effective interlock with key stakeholders to understand business needs and priorities. Seek out novel data sources and make them available for modeling purposes

 

 

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • Prior experience in a data engineering, business intelligence, or similar role, or equivalent education in a computer science/engineering field
  • Relevant data pipeline design, build and deploy experience. Proficiency in SQL and data modelling using Google Cloud Platform, including Big Query and Cloud Storage
  • Previous experience designing data processing systems with validation and logging practices an asset
  • Data visualization experience using Data Studio, Looker, Domo, Tableau, PowerBI, or similar
  • Light development experience with Python, Javascript, and/or C# a plus for more complex data extraction, transformation, ingestion
  • Working knowledge of job scheduling platforms and orchestration (Apache NiFi)

item.title: Senior Software Developer
item.description:
Description

Join our team 

 

Become part of a future friendly national team, one that embraces change and initiates opportunity, has a passion for growth, believes in spirited teamwork, and has the courage to innovate. Our success is based as much on your dedication and hard work as it is on the innovative television, internet, voice, data and wireless products and solutions we offer. 

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together 

 

As part of our Smart Cities and Home Services team, you will imagine, create, support and test innovative smart cities and live streaming services for TELUS. This is an opportunity for you to develop solutions and designs for streaming video while providing our customers with the best video streaming experiences. We’re stretching the boundaries of what is possible, and supporting and enabling local communities to expand their audiences.

 

Here\'s how

 

  • Provide leadership and architectural support for CI/CD pipeline and software development practices for a small team of developers
  • Create, test, and support new systems and services that you help create, operating in a dev-ops team.
  • Bring familiarity with building and using containers and other cloud-native tools
  • Develop new architectures and technologies to deliver the best viewing experience for our customers.
  • Develop and maintain technical documentation and architecture
  • Apply best practices of software development in different frameworks and troubleshoot integration issues
  • Automate service testing to ensure reliable and repeatable results.
  • Ensure a high level of code quality and integrity in software development projects
  • Work with Project Managers and Network Planners to ensure the successful delivery of projects
  • An understanding of the importance of automation and continuous integration and deployment

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  • 5+ years of software development experience utilizing CI/CD practices and agile methodologies
  • Extensive experience with cloud-native tools and cloud environments (GCP and AWS)
  • Capable of mentoring developers and sharing your knowledge
  • Strong troubleshooting methodology
  • An interest in video streaming technologies
  • Insatiable curiosity for problem solving, technology and innovation
  • Desire to learn and take on new challenges
  • Ability to collaborate with diverse groups and technical teams
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Having a creative approach to problem solving and an ability to work independently in an environment with high levels of ambiguity
  • Ability to manage key deliverables as part of an extended project team
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, talented at developing and fostering positive relationships with other team members
  • Bachelors in Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Python, Java, C#
  • MySQL, MongoDB or equivalent databases
  • Docker, Kubernetes, Istio, Ansible
  • GitHub, AzureDevops, BitBucket, or equivalent source control repositories
  • Github Workflows, ArgoCD, Google CloudBuild, Helm or equivalent CI-CD pipeline tools
  • Adaptive bitrate streaming including HLS, DASH, and CDN technologies
  • Video analytics powered by machine learning technologies

FFHJOBS

item.title: Cloud Data Architect
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

The Data Enterprise Data Layer team designs, implements and oversees the GCP analytics platform at TELUS.  Known as the DataHub, our team architects and operationalizes the underlying infrastructure used to power data solutions that drive value and deliver results from analytics. Our platforms provide the organization with modern cloud native services, DataOps methodologies and processes, and a self-serve data environment to test & learn and productionalize data models enabling data driven decisions.  Our vision is to empower our TELUS business partners with a standardized platform utilizing infrastructure, policy and governance as code, setting guide rails for teams to develop their data & analytics use cases within our cloud data platform.

We are looking for technical enthusiasts who can help build our next generation solution.
Together we will build and enable best-in-class data platforms with a focus on expanding our capabilities while ensuring always available analytics in Google’s Cloud Platform.
 
Enable teams across the organization to make better use of data. Use your analytical skills and ability to assess the impact of data on upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. Help architect the transformation and modernization of our enterprise data solutions and the integration of Google Cloud and native GCP services and 3rd party data technologies.


What you’ll do

 

  • Work with and listen to business and technical teams to understand their needs
  • Define the ideal cloud data architecture with a focus on self-serve, efficiency, security and privacy
  • Design and implement solutions that move us forward on our MLOPs, DevOps and infrastructure as code journey within GCP
  • Collaborate kindly and proactively with the rest of our team and our customers (internal teams at TELUS)
  • Implement best in class cloud architecture to solve business use cases from concept to production
  • Identify opportunities for automation and implement in the development and production process
  • Provision and maintain existing platforms to facilitate growth and stability
  • Author quality documentation for any solutions implemented on both how they were implemented and how to use them

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  • You are collaborative and able to work with various IT and business teams to deliver on outcomes 
  • You are able to share a vision and implement long-term data strategies while providing value early and often along the journey
  • You have in depth knowledge of data architecture both on premise and on GCP, AWS and / or Azure platforms and have demonstrated experience designing and implementing enterprise grade data environments
  • You have experience with cloud-native technologies, such as Terraform, Kubernetes, Composer and serverless computing
  • You have in depth experience with the flow of data between systems, cloud big data environments and tooling with applications such as BigQuery, Dataflow, BigTable, Data Catalog, CloudSQL, Vertex AI, Pub/Sub, Dataprep and Cloud Spanner
  • You can design and deploy distributed, multi-technology, data processing systems
  • You have experience with YAML and/or JSON for configuration
  • You can explain complex systems interactions, data flows, common interfaces, and APIs to senior leaders and business stakeholders
  • You understand that system stability drives availability and customer trust
  • You have demonstrated experience with Secure by Design and Zero Trust data architectures and are able to provision cloud infrastructure with best in class security
  • You have in depth knowledge of PII and privacy compliance and have demonstrated architectural design, system interactions and life cycle management that puts customer safety first
  • You are able to provide guidance to optimize data collection, storage, and consumption by choosing the right platforms and tools for the right use casesYou have good understanding of DevOps & DataOps principles and tools

 

Great-to-haves

 

 

  • Experience with Google’s BigQuery service
  • Experience with MLOPs methodologies and process
  • Data Warehousing and data modeling design experience
  • Experience with FinOps and Cloud platform budget management

item.title: Senior Strategy Manager, Data Platforms
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

The Enterprise Data Layer team designs, implements and oversees the GCP analytics platform at TELUS.  Known as the DataHub, our team architects and operationalizes the underlying infrastructure used to power data solutions that drive value and deliver results from analytics. Our platforms provide the organization with modern cloud native services, modern BI tools, DataOps methodologies and processes, and a self-serve data environment to test & learn and productionalize data models enabling data driven decisions.  Our vision is to empower our TELUS business partners with a standardized platform utilizing infrastructure, policy and governance as code, setting guide rails for teams to develop their data & analytics use cases within our cloud data platform and BI toolsets.

 

We are looking for enthusiasts who can help build our next generation solutions enabling best-in-class data platforms with a focus on expanding our capabilities while ensuring always available analytics in Google’s Cloud Platform.  You will support digital transformation at TELUS by partnering with teams across the organization to make better use of their data. Use your strong communication, critical thinking and change management experience to assess the impact of transformation on our partner teams, the upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. 

 

What you’ll do

 

  • Support the establishment of data a shared strategy across the enterprise to enable the business to meet its strategic and financial objectives
  • Support the creation of automated work intake process, prioritization, metrics, process improvements and resource alignment to planned roadmaps
  • Drive a governed approach with increasing maturity around our data & analytics platforms and tools
  • Liaise with our business and IT partners to ensure alignment on roadmaps and strategic initiatives delivering value and supporting a data driven culture
  • Lead annual strategy reviews for the Enterprise Data Platforms team and collaborate with owners in our larger business unit including coordination and material creation
  • Monitor trends, innovation and opportunities in the industry and with our Vendors
  • Support your DataOps team members in delivering the ideal cloud data architecture with a focus on self-serve, efficiency, security and privacy
  • Identify opportunities for automation and implement in the development and production process
  • Support our internal web presence, knowledge portal, intake process, and “Quick Reference Guides” increasing customer awareness and standardization of data environments across TELUS
  • Author quality documentation and materials to support messaging around new data capabilities, services and analytics tools, roadmaps, customer onboarding to our data platform, roadmaps, change management and alignment across IT teams

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  • 5-7 years of experience in a Management Consulting, Digital agency or Corporate Strategy with a large organization
  • 3-5 years of experience working in Technology
  • Experience helping organizations evolve their way of working, defining and implementing new operating models and standing up Transformation efforts
  • You are an exceptional communicator that excels at compelling storytelling and presentations
  • You have good understanding of Data & Analytics principles and tools and digital transformation initiatives
  • You have experience managing business stakeholders and engaging with many diverse technical teams to aligning deliverables
  • You have a proven track record of engaging with technical leaders and SMEs to create quality roadmaps to be reviewed and accepted at a senior level within the organization
  • You are collaborative and able to work with various IT and business teams to deliver on outcomes 
  • You are able to share a vision and implement long-term data strategies while providing value early and often along the journey
  • You can distill complex solutions and interactions to gain support and engagement with senior leaders and business stakeholders
  • You have experience working with IT vendors and corporate partners

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Experience with Google Cloud Platform
  • Enterprise Architecture experience specifically in the data space
  • Experience with FinOps and Cloud platform budget management
  • University degree in Business, Information Technology Management or Engineering

item.title: Manager, Data Engineering
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

We are searching for a talented candidate to become our team’s Manager, Enterprise Data Engineering. Reporting to the Director – Enterprise Data Engineering, the successful candidate will be responsible for leading a team of accomplished data analysts, engineers and architects supporting our data and analytics platform transformation. This role will be an agent of change and support the evolving strategy, data and analytics roadmaps as well as provide overarching direction to support our TELUS Business Solutions Team (TBS).

 

The portfolio will focuses on continuous improvement to our GCP engineering practices (common ingestion framework), CI/CD pipelines, DevOps, SRE, real-time data ingestion, addressing technical debt and support the Business Master Data Management (MDM) and Revenue Generating Unit (RGU) workstreams. Our team is a cloud first team and leverages the latest technologies to fuel our mission and purpose.

 

What you’ll do

 

 At TELUS, we put ‘Customers First’. With a broad set of responsibilities and a high degree of visibility across the TELUS organization, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to:

 

  • Lead a team of talented data platform Analysts, Engineers and Architects to drive the modernization of our data platforms
  • Foster internal and external stakeholder relationships, including managing senior executive participants
  • Provide guidance to establish standards and best practices for building enterprise grade data pipelines
  • Work with our preferred Cloud service providers to align our roadmap based on their release schedule for services and product offerings.
  • Construct comprehensive business cases and financial models leveraging various methods to support strategic projects and decisions with data driven insights
  • Utilize internal and external data points coupled with market research on marketplace dynamics impacting TELUS and the Data Strategy team to inform opportunities and risks for the team
  • Create technology roadmaps for business partners, executive management, and external audiences to enhance strategic decision making and support technology investment recommendations
  • Collaborate with key stakeholders to create, track and evolve the team scorecards and strategic imperatives
  • Support the annual strategic and financial planning process
  • Flex your communication, negotiation, and influencing skills, working with a broad set of internal stakeholders, executives and external partners
  • Mentor, lead, and support a diverse and very talented team

Qualifications


What you bring

 

You have experience in technical leadership, managing data platforms, business intelligence tools and setting architectural direction

  • You can communicate clearly and effectively in both technical and business matters able to translate technical considerations into business implications
  • You are analytical and outcome-oriented with a proven ability to translate business requirements into high-level design models
  • You have hands on knowledge of foundational cloud data architecture of lakes, warehouses, data modeling, and life cycle management
  • You have demonstrated experience with the governance and oversight of data privacy, security and the ethical use of data in previous roles
  • You have experience with cloud migration projects, agile methodologies, and DevOps practices
  • You have impressive people leadership track record with proven ability to recruit, coach, mentor and lead high performing teams in a fast-paced environment
  • You are a skilled relationship builder and skilled at prioritization, negotiation and influencing
  • You can pivot between supporting the urgent needs of the business and the long-term roadmap
  • You have experience working on and supporting large, complex technical projects that involve multiple stakeholders and business units
  • You have exposure to tools, technologies and programming languages including, but not limited to, Python, Airflow (composer), SQL, Apache Nifi, Hive, Spark, Dataflow (Apache Beam) and Kafka
  • You have experience creating a vision for and implementing a culture of change to drive CI/CD, DevOps and other opportunities for operational effectivenes

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Bachelor of Computer Science or equivalent
  • 5+ years of progressive and relevant work experience with enterprise data
  • PMP certification is an asset
  • Experience with the data offerings in the Google Cloud Platform
  • Experience in the telecommunications industry
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to lead a large team

item.title: Senior Business Analyst (Data Specialist)
item.description:
Description

 

As part of our exciting journey towards retiring our copper network, we’ve established a brand-new, transformational TELUS-wide program. This program will address network optimization with the goal to eliminate dual support cost structures between the Copper and Fibre network, fully unleashing the benefits of our generational investment in our PureFibre network. We are scaling the program and seeking team members to be part of one of the most transformational projects at TELUS.

 

Join our team:

 

  • Located within our Customer Network Implementation (CNI) team, a team that is a key driver of TELUS’ annual ~$2.9 billion in capital expenditure, our copper retirement program will be responsible for the development and execution of our one network strategy
  • We are focused on aligning key stakeholders across the organization to accelerate the journey to Fibre, optimize our Central Office (CO) footprint, enable power cost savings and ultimately shut down our copper network across communities
  • This work will also help transform the customer experience, field delivery and network quality, and reliability metrics in our new Fibre dominant footprint
  • Visit www.telus.com/copperretirement to learn more about the program

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

 As a Sr Business Analyst in Project Penny, you will be accountable for liaising with key business stakeholders, understanding the business context and tackling roadblocks. You will accomplish your objectives by identifying opportunities, driving innovation and working closely with stakeholders to support copper retirement deliverables. 

 

Here’s how

 

  • You drive work to completion and effectively manage and report on scope, risks & issues, and timelines 
  • You can demonstrate a proven capability to engage key stakeholders and work across different business units leveraging the most appropriate collaboration tools to support virtual team working
  • You migrate various data to interactive and automated dashboards 
  • You take analytics framework into the next level and lead stakeholders to adopt new frameworks and methodologies
  • You will partner with senior leaders and stakeholders to drive key strategic and transformational initiatives to ensure TELUS consistently outperforms our competition
  • You are an organized and compelling communicator with the ability to clearly articulate complex concepts and storylines through various mediums, especially Google Mail, Slides, Docs, Sheets, Forms, DOMO and other platforms

 

 

Qualifications

 

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • 3+ years of business analyst experience within technology and analytics 
  • 3+ years of experience developing intermediate to advanced SQL queries to operate database & data processing
  • 3+ years of experience performing data analysis and data quality
  • 1-3 years of experience with Python/R for data science
  • Able to see the big picture objectives of product analytics and bring that understanding to requirements definition and help drive prioritization based on existing technology constraint
  • Demonstrated experience translating business needs and/or new ideas into detailed business requirements, to be further developed into technology solutions
  • Experience gathering and analyzing business requirements; preparing architecture diagrams, and documenting solutions end to end
  • Ability to coordinate competing priorities across multiple stakeholder groups

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Prior experience with Agile and Jira 
  • Knowledge and experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and DOMO
  • Experience with GIS
  • Knowledge of programming and/or scripting languages (Java, bash, Node JS etc)
  • Experience with legacy copper networks and their products and services
  • Mulesoft and API integration experience

item.title: Perception Team Lead - Localization and Mapping
item.description:
Description

Position:                  Perception Team Lead - Localization and Mapping               
Location:                 Kitchener, Ontario             
Job Type:                Full-Time Permanent
Experience:            5-10 Years Relevant Work Experience
Education:              Graduate Degree in a related field
Division:                OTTO Motors


About OTTO Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics

At OTTO Motors, we believe material handling is one of the most dangerous and unproductive parts of modern industrial operations. Our mission is to create safer, more productive and fulfilling workplaces with autonomous material handling technology. Most recently, OTTO Motors was recognized among the top 1% of Canada’s highest-performing global private companies by Communitech. Our loyal customers are also the most recognizable brands in the world and trust OTTO Motors to fulfill their mission-critical material handling needs: General Electric, Toyota, Hershey, Caterpillar, Berry Global, and more. For more information about us, visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

We\'re looking for a driven, resourceful, motivated candidate for the Perception Team Lead position. This person will lead a team of developers to create and maintain the next generation of perception algorithms to tackle the toughest challenges in localization and mapping, state estimation, computer vision and more.

The localization and mapping team’s primary responsibility is the development of the core robotics software responsible for environmental perception, mapping and localization on all our vehicles. You will be responsible for evaluating state-of-the-art ideas from academia and industry, and taking these ideas out of the lab and into the real world, identifying opportunities to improve, and developing high-performance software to run in real time on the robots. As part of the perception team you will continue to advance the cutting edge of robotics research through collaboration with our academic partners and contributions to research publications and open source initiatives.

About You

For the role of Perception Team Lead we are seeking an experienced developer and leader to drive the development of state-of-the-art localization and mapping solutions for real world applications.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Lead a team of exceptional perception developers to create robust innovative solutions to the problems of robotic perception
  • Development of custom SLAM, localization, computer vision, and perception algorithms
  • Evaluation of new algorithms and sensing technology
  • Assisting with concept development for new products and projects
  • Supporting deployment and testing of robotic systems
  • Supervising and mentoring team members
  • Collaboration with internal teams including controls and navigation, as well as academic and industrial partners
  • Stay up to the date with the latest developments from academia and industry

Skills and experience:

  • Graduate degree in engineering/CS or a related field
  • Practical and theoretical knowledge in at least one or more areas of: state estimation, computer vision, SLAM, localization, mapping, or sensor modeling.
  • Strong software development skills in modern C++
  • Understanding of software development workflows, life cycles and development methodologies and tools.
  • Excellent leadership, teamwork, and communication skills
  • Ability to independently develop software development plans, including scope, timelines, resource estimates, and test procedures.

Bonus points for:

  • Hands-on experience with real world autonomous systems
  • Experience with leading software development teams.
  • Experience writing efficient, high performance code
  • ROS, Gazebo, OpenCV and PCL experience
  • Familiarity with graph optimization techniques and libraries
  • Understanding of sensor error modeling, particularly laser rangefinders and vision systems

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, gender identity/expression, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Senior Autonomy Developer - Calibration and Sensors
item.description:
Description

Position: Senior Autonomy Developer - Calibration and Sensors              
Location: Kitchener, Ontario             
Job Type: Full-Time Permanent
Experience: 3+ Years Relevant Work Experience
Education: Masters or PhD Degree in a related field
Division: OTTO Motors


About OTTO Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics

At OTTO Motors, we believe material handling is one of the most dangerous and unproductive parts of modern industrial operations. Our mission is to create safer, more productive and fulfilling workplaces with autonomous material handling technology. Most recently, OTTO Motors was recognized among the top 1% of Canada’s highest-performing global private companies by Communitech. Our loyal customers are also the most recognizable brands in the world and trust OTTO Motors to fulfill their mission-critical material handling needs: General Electric, Toyota, Hershey, Caterpillar, Berry Global, and more. For more information about us, visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The OTTO Motors division of Clearpath is looking for a Perception Developer to work on the Perception Team in the Vehicle Software Group to focus on the development of sensor calibration algorithms.

Clearpath\'s OTTO Motors robots lead the industry in self-driving materials handling, and you can help us push robotics to the next level of intelligence and performance. This means continually learning, inventing, and implementing new algorithms, all with an emphasis on robust and reliable best practice programming. We\'re looking for people excited to develop the next generation of perception algorithms to tackle the toughest challenges in localization and mapping, calibration, sensing, machine learning, computer vision and more.

The perception team’s primary responsibility is the development of the core robotics software responsible for environmental sensing and understanding on all of our vehicles. As a Perception Developer - Calibration and Sensors you will develop & maintain algorithms and processes for the complete continuous calibration of robotic systems and processing of sensor data. You will be creating solutions to the challenging problems of high accuracy intrinsic and extrinsic calibration of heterogeneous sensor configurations and actuators as well as online calibration and sensor processing and monitoring for a wide range of possible robotic platforms. You will be responsible for evaluating state-of-the-art ideas from academia and industry, and taking these ideas out of the lab and into the real world, identifying opportunities to improve, and developing high-performance software to run in real time on the robots.

About You

For the role of Perception Developer - Calibration we are seeking an experienced developer to support, maintain, and extend robotic calibration solutions for a variety of applications.

Responsibilities:

  • Create robust innovative solutions to the problems of robotic calibration and perception
  • Development of custom calibration, sensor monitoring, sensor filtering, and perception algorithms
  • Evaluation of new sensing technology and robotic platforms
  • Work with production to develop processes for sensor calibration methods
  • Develop integration and unit tests for perception features
  • Supporting deployment and testing of robotic systems
  • Stay up to date with the latest developments in industry and academia 

Skills and experience:

  • Strong theoretical and practical understanding of the challenges and solutions to the problems of robotic system calibration
  • Practical knowledge of sensing technologies including LIDAR, Cameras, IMU, and their error models
  • Familiarity with robotic platforms and their motion models such as differential, ackerman, bicycle, etc.
  • Proficient software development skills in modern C++
  • Proficiency with Linux environment

Bonus Points For:

  • Hands-on experience with real world autonomous systems
  • Experience writing efficient, high performance code
  • Experience with ROS / Robotics Systems.
  • Proficiency with linear algebra and non-linear optimization including libraries such as ceres solver and Eigen
  • Experience with computer vision libraries such as PCL and OpenCV.
  • Experience with manufacturing tolerances of robotic systems

 

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, gender identity/expression, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Senior Simulation Developer
item.description:
Description

Position:         Senior Simulation Developer          
Location:         Kitchener, Ontario             
Job Type:        Full-Time Permanent
Experience:    2 - 5 years of relevant work experience
Education:      Degree in a related field
Division:        OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The OTTO Motors division of Clearpath is looking for a Simulation Developer to work in the Fleet Software Group.

The Fleet Software Group is responsible for the design, development and support of the Fleet Manager and software applications that allow our users to interact with, monitor and support their fleets of OTTO Autonomous Vehicles. This involves participation in the entire product workflow, from customer insight gathering, problem definition, solution proposals, application design, development and support.

For this role we are seeking an individual to develop & maintain software tools and assets used in our simulation stack. You will be working closely with other members of the DevOps, Vehicle Systems, Fleet software development teams as well as many other groups within OTTO Motors, in order to provide robust and easy-to-use solutions to the problems our employees & customers need to solve with their simulation environments and workflows.

About You

For the role of Simulation Developer we are seeking an experienced developer to support, maintain, and extend robotic simulations in a full-stack simulation environment in a small team.  Your work will directly support a variety of internal groups in testing, developing and training.

Responsibilities:

  • Designing and developing new simulation tools and assets.
  • Maintaining and extending existing simulation automation/deployment tools and assets.
  • Improving useability and robustness of our simulation tool set.
  • Writing internal documentation for new and existing simulation tools and assets.
  • Troubleshooting simulation automation/deployment issues and bugs.
  • Supporting development operations, internal tools, and infrastructure.
  • Supporting development systems infrastructure.

 Additional responsibilities may include:

  • Developing, maintaining, and extending simulation plugins, both internal and upstream.
  • Alerting the team and stopping the robots from starting their own revolution.

Skills and experience:

  • Minimum 2-5 years of experience in software development in an enterprise environment.
  • Object-oriented programming experience (C++).
  • Working with Linux/Ubuntu based environments and scripting (Bash, Python 3.5+).
  • Use of emplating formats and markup languages (e.g. XML, YAML, JSON).
  • Using continuous integration (Jenkins/GitLab pipelines) and source control (Git).
  • Diagnosing and narrowing down the source of issues.
  • Working in a collaborative virtual environment, interfacing with other team members regularly, sharing knowledge via diagram, discussion, and example.
  • Creating/maintaining virtual models & environments in a physics based simulator.

Bonus Points For:

  • Other object-oriented programming experience (e.g. C#, Java)
  • Experience with ROS / Robotics Systems.
  • Experience with Gazebo/Unity/Unreal/Isaac simulation.
  • Experience in 3D graphics software and programming.
  • Experience with containers and Kubernetes
  • Familiarity with Nix

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, gender identity/expression, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Test Developer
item.description:
Description

Position:            Test Developer
Location:           Kitchener, Ontario    
Job Type:           Full-Time Permanent          
Experience:       0-3 Years
Education:        College Diploma, with 0-3 years\' work experience in ME/EE/SW or Testing 
Division:           OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

We believe in providing our clients with specific solutions to their problems. This might mean prototyping new hardware platforms, developing custom software applications, or processing 3D point clouds. Our projects range from one-off development of multi-ton unmanned ground vehicles to mass production of custom built environmental monitoring equipment.

We\'re looking for a Test Developer to take our testing and validation to the next level and help us to get our hardware doing what it\'s been built to do.  You will take charge of test plan development and execution for various products and custom projects, to ensure that our hardware and software is co-existing harmoniously. This will range from designing test campaigns to identify and eliminate issues early on, through to tail end validation focused on detailed product verification. Your goal is to increase efficiencies and reliability with regards to product testing and validation. You will work closely with the rest of the Clearpath development team to make sure that we are delivering properly engineered solutions. 

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Designing test campaigns
  • Executing test for full system, component, simulation, and performance
  • Documenting test results
  • Capturing issues and artifacts, establishing strong feedback loop back into development
  • Extending test frameworks
  • Supporting CI and internal tools and infrastructure
  • Supporting development systems infrastructure 

Additional responsibilities may include:

  • Developing simulations, maintaining and extending testing standards and best practices
  • Testing and validating product components used in projects
  • Determining or helping to drive test requirements for new products, components, or projects as required
  • Alerting the team and stopping the robots from starting their own revolution

 About You

You want to work for a fast-paced growing company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are motivated, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with less than 100% effort. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.

Your programming background is strong and you’re able to diagnose issues faster than the speed of light. You like the thought of working on projects that interact with the world, even more so when they can do so on their own. You\'re looking for a job where you get to interact with a diverse team and learn something new every day. We can\'t promise it\'ll be interesting or relevant, but it\'ll be new!

Required Experience/Skills:

  • College Diploma in a relevant technical field
  • 1-5 years’ working in mechanical, electrical, software design or testing environments (or Post Graduates with similar exposure)
  • Experience with testing validation of complex integrated systems and/or software
  • Python or similar Object Oriented programming experience (C++, Java, Javascript, Ruby, etc.)
  • Strong verbal and written communications
  • Strong analytical, trouble shooting and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work well independently, as well as in a team environment

Bonus Experience/skills:

  • Combination of experience designing, implementing, maintaining or executing technical acceptance plans
  • Experience with Linux / Unix operating systems
  • Experience with Unix scripting languages (e.g. bash, shell, awk etc.)
  • Git or similar version control experience (BitBucket, Github, etc.)
  • Understanding of continuous integration concepts and tools (e.g. Jenkins, BuildBot, etc.), and best practices
  • Familiarity with defect tracking systems such as JIRA
  • Experience with analysis with tools like iPython Notebook, Matlab or others
  • Hands on experience with software/hardware mixed products, which may utilize motor controls, machine controls, and various sensory components in combination with software

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Electrical Development Team Lead
item.description:
Description

Position:           Electrical Development Team Lead
Location:          Kitchener, ON
Job Type:          Full-Time Permanent
Experience:     5+ years relevant work experience
Education:       Degree in a related field or equivalent work experience
Division:           OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

You will guide and manage the Electrical Development Engineering team by providing tactical day-to-day guidance and direction; establishing team strategy (objectives, metrics, priorities, and best practices); enabling the team to perform at their best, as well as applying your technical expertise to solve complex problems.  In addition, you will be responsible for significant portions of the electrical system design and implementation for our new and existing products.

The Electrical Development team works closely with our hardware, software, and new product development teams to establish sustainable development and support of our products, providing a robust design to our customers.

In addition, the team will adhere to safety standards and processes such as ISO13849, ISO12100, IEC61508, R15.08, and IEC 3691-4 or similar standards applicable to mobile robots.

Furthermore, the team is a contributor to defining our product requirements and is an influencer of our product roadmap.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Delegate, schedule, and manage tasks within the Electrical Development Team’s domain
  • Providing performance and development feedback
  • Ensuring consistent quality of service and deliverables from the Electrical Development group
  • Working with and improving our existing processes for Electrical design and development on our products
  • Adapting and improving the overall service and performance
  • Develop working relationships with vendors to help ensure OTTO motors is selecting the highest quality and latest technology parts in our products
  • Lead some technical projects yourself
  • Industrial control system design and architecture with an eye to ISO 13849, ANSI B56.5, IEC 61508 and others as needed.
  • Support high-level vehicle architecture design
  • First level of triage for electrical issues
  • Verifying basic robot functionality (ROS skills as needed)
  • Prototype assembly (Build parts of the robot as needed) 
  • Design Documentation (Meeting minutes, requirements definition, architecture documents, controls analysis, CAD, PLM, internal troubleshooting, assembly and installation documentation)
  • Write and execute good validation and test  plans for new vehicle technologies that make clear and actionable conclusions
  • Be knowledgeable in the robot product lifecycle, and bring-in feedback from all relevant parties at the right time.

Required skills:

  • Degree in engineering, computer science, robotics, or a related field with applicable background
  • 1-2+ years’ experience in a management role in an engineering environment 
  • 5+ years of experience in electrical engineering roles
  • Effective decision making
  • Strong communicator
  • Project and resource management experience
  • Technical acuity (e.g., ideas contributor to implementation strategies, product features and requirements)
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision and manage deadlines.
  • Experience with hands-on prototyping and troubleshooting of electromechanical systems
  • Able to understand and communicate concepts readily via sketches, block diagrams, flow charts, and technical writing
  • Able to work in Canada

Bonus Points for:

  • Experience working with industrial robots.
  • Experience in designing to comply with the European, US and Canadian standards, particularly FCC and CE or liaising with NRTLs
  • Experience with design for functional safety (ISO 12100, EN 61508, etc.)
  • Knowledge of WHMA/IPC-A-620
  • Experience with C Language software solutions on embedded platforms e.g. C++ and Python
  • Experience with the V-model or other similar verification and validation methodologies 
  • Working knowledge of aspects of mobile robotics such as perception, planning, controls, and navigation
  • Power distribution and motor systems
  • Low speed digital/analog circuit design
  • Cable assembly design
  • PCBA design, microprocessor and network integration (CAN, Ethernet, ModBUS etc.)
  • Familiarity with industrial material handling vehicles
  • Experience with ROS
  • Past hands-on experience with mobile robots, industrial trucks, or AGCs as an operator or developer

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Robot Builder
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Robotics

Position: Robot Builder

Location: Kitchener, Ontario

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics’ research solutions group is a global leader in unmanned vehicle robotics for research and development, and provides hardware, software, and services to enable self-driving vehicle development, deployment, and operation. Clearpath Robotics works with over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands in over 40 countries, serving markets that span mining, military, agriculture, aerospace, and academia. Visit Clearpath Robotics at www.clearpathrobotics.com.

About the Job:

We are currently selling more robots than we can build! We require a handy individual to take charge of assembling a variety of different platforms and ensuring that we perpetually strive for a higher level of quality. We need a Robot Builder to take responsibility in assembling our core products along with their accessories.

You will contribute to a team dedicated to seeing a robotic platform from start to finish. Additionally, when you are not wrenchin’ down screws, you will be tasked with maintaining the organization and cleanliness of the production area.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Electromechanical Assembly of robotic platforms 
    • Use of hand tools
    • Use of hoisting equipment
    • Cable installation and wire routing
  • Rotating throughout different assembly stations to achieve cross-training among team members
  • Ensuring your workspace follows 5S guidelines
  • Using a computer for work instructions via VKS system
  • Production area maintenance
  • Production equipment maintenance
  • Other duties as assigned

About You:

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied doing a job less than 100%.  You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  

Required Skills:

  • Experience working on manual product assembly
  • Wiring or cable installation experience preferred
  • Hands-on experience with common tools, eg, screwdriver, hammer, and electric drills.
  • Practical knowledge of Microsoft Office Excel and GSuite
  • Able to work the Day shift Hours 7am - 3pm Monday to Friday
  • Positive and professional attitude with safety mindset
  • Proven ability to work independently
  • Experience working with ERP systems is an asset.
  • Ability to follow written assembly work instructions in English
  • Comfortable with abrupt changes to project deadlines.
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs comfortably 

Bonus points for:

  • Hobbies that involve working with power tools, woodworking for instance
  • Hobbies that involve assembly with hand tools, car maintenance for instance
  • Lean manufacturing experience
  • Continuous Improvement Process
  • 5S methodology
  • Previously being part of a Health & Safety Committee

What’s in it for you:

  • Work life balance - vacation, flexible long weekends, half-day birthdays and wellness days
  • Competitive salary and career growth opportunities
  • Comprehensive benefits for you and your family to support your health and wellness
  • Corporate discounts and Group Insurance (home and auto)
  • Free snacks to keep you energized during the shift!
  • Cool company events such as BBQs and other celebrations including occasional food trucks at the facilities
  • Growth opportunities 
  • Friendly and fun co-workers!

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Client Success Manager
item.description:
Description

Position:               Client Success Manager            
Location:               Kitchener, ON or Remote/Virtual, Canada                       
Experience:          10+ years’ experience
Job Type:              Full-Time Permanent     
Education:            Degree in relevant field
Division:               OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The Client Success Manager (CSM) role is responsible for nurturing client relationships and helping our clients realize value through rapid adoption and ongoing use of our solution.  CSM’s are the relationship leaders that secure long-term relationships, drive adoption of OTTO Motors’ solutions, team up with Account Executives to upsell new products and services, drive customer relationships and loyalty, and are highly motivated to provide our clients with the absolute best in service and support.  

This is a great opportunity for a creative, energetic thinker, able to understand the client’s business needs and use cases and know how to be a trusted partner so our clients stay and continue to grow with OTTO Motors. If you love working with customers and have thrived in a role like this before, then we want to talk to you.

Core Competencies

  • Accountability
  • Adaptability
  • Analytical Thinking
  • Critical Thinking
  • Decision Making
  • Planning and Organizing
  • Problem Solving
  • Results Orientation

Primary responsibilities include:

  • Helps customers to realize and maximize the full value of their in-production systems
  • Accountable for maintaining a stable of client relationships
  • Captures opportunities to increase profitable revenue growth within existing OTTO Motors’ sites through increasing demand for existing services or by introducing new services in partnership with Account Executives
  • Meets with customers regularly to review support and system performance that demonstrates health, production, and value of system
  • Owns support renewals for assigned accounts
  • Works with internal teams to drive customer satisfaction (servers as a voice of the customer within the organization)
  • Lead onboarding for new support customers (transition from project teams to support team)
  • Identifies and provides (or sets up) customer training
  • Identifies changes that the customer has made to their system and coordinates updating the support team
  • Work with our internal teams to ensure alignment and provide a cohesive experience. When necessary, you will act as the point of support account escalation to help drive resolution to high impact or long-term customer issues
  • Your metrics: Adoption Rate, Customer Lifetime Value, Net Promoter Score, Churn Rate, and CSAT
  • This role involves regular travel to customer sites across North America (approx. 4 times a quarter - short visits)

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.

You possess a natural affinity with people, the ability to listen to the customer’s needs, a large amount of common sense and business acumen, which will allow you to successfully manage, sell and handle a dynamic changing market.

Required skills:

  • BA/BS degree, Technology related diploma, or equivalent experience
  • Minimum of 3 - 5 years of Project Management, Technical Support leadership, Technical Consultant, or Customer Success experience
  • Strong people management and relationship management skills
  • Exceptional planning and organizing skills
  • Self-motivated, proactive team player with innovative ideas to inspire customer loyalty and adoption
  • Personable, with strong communication skills
  • Proven selling, influencing, persuasion and negotiation skills

item.title: Robot Mechanic
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Inc.

Position:         Robot Mechanic            
Location:         Kitchener, Ontario             
Job Type:         Full-Time Permanent
Experience:    3-5 Years Relevant Work Experience
Education:      Certificate
Experience:     0-3 Years’ experience selling technical products, preferably material handling solutions
Division:          OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job:

We are currently selling more robots than we can build! We require a handy individual to take charge of performing a variety of different tasks troubleshooting and repairing different platforms and ensuring that we perpetually strive for a higher level of quality. We need a Robot Mechanic to take responsibility in ensuring the product performs as designed and troubleshooting when required.

You will contribute to a team dedicated to delivering a top-quality robot. Additionally, when you are not running scripts, you will be tasked with maintaining the organization of the documentation.

This position requires the mechanic to be onsite for the full daily shift. There is no opportunity to work from home.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

- Align, fit, or assemble component parts using hand tools, power tools, fixtures, and templates.
- Troubleshoot robotic systems using knowledge of microprocessors, programmable controllers (PLCs), electronics, circuit analysis, mechanics, sensor or feedback systems, hydraulics, or pneumatics.
- Test the performance of robotic assemblies using instruments such as oscilloscopes, electronic voltmeters, or bridges.
- Disassemble and reassemble robots or peripheral equipment to make repairs, such as replacing defective circuit boards, sensors, controllers, encoders, and servo motors.
- Analyze the root cause of the problem to identify the appropriate solution and share it with Stakeholders.
- Document and share your steps of troubleshooting, corrective actions, and applying fixes or repairs.
- Document and Program the test procedures.
- Assist engineers in designing, configuring and troubleshooting robotic systems.
- Analyze equipment breakdown metrics to develop predictive and preventative maintenance of assets.
- Perform scheduled preventive or corrective maintenance on equipment, facilities or robotic systems.
- Train customers or other personnel to install, use, or maintain robots.
- Other duties as assigned

Required Skills:
- Knowledge of circuit boards, processors, chips, electronic equipment, and computer hardware and software, including applications and programming
- Electro-Mechanical Technician/Troubleshooting experience
- Creative thinking and Problem-Solving skills
- Coding/writing scripts in ROS
- Positive and professional attitude with a safety mindset
- Proven ability to work independently
- Experience working with ERP systems is an asset.
- Ability to lift up to 25 lbs comfortably

Bonus points for:
- Experience as a Mechanic.
- Programming Experience.
- Mechanical or Electrical Design Experience.
- Hobbies that involve working with power tools/hand tools like woodworking or Car Maintenance
- Lean manufacturing experience
- Continuous Improvement Process
- 6S methodology
- Qualified to operate a forklift

What’s in it for you:
- Work life balance - vacation, flexible long weekends, half-day birthdays and wellness days
- Competitive salary and career growth opportunities
- Comprehensive benefits for you and your family to support your health and wellness
- Corporate discounts and Group Insurance (home and auto)
- Free snacks to keep you energized during the shift!
- Cool company events such as BBQs and other celebrations including occasional food trucks at the facilities
- Growth opportunities 
- Friendly and fun co-workers!

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Field Services Technician
item.description:
Description

Position:        Field Service Technician              
Location:       Kitchener, Ontario             
Job Type:      Full-Time Permanent
Experience:   0-3 Years Relevant Work Experience
Education:    Undergraduate degree or college diploma in a related field
Division:        OTTO Motors


About OTTO Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics

At OTTO Motors, we believe material handling is one of the most dangerous and unproductive parts of modern industrial operations. Our mission is to create safer, more productive and fulfilling workplaces with autonomous material handling technology. Most recently, OTTO Motors was recognized among the top 1% of Canada’s highest-performing global private companies by Communitech. Our loyal customers are also the most recognizable brands in the world and trust OTTO Motors to fulfill their mission-critical material handling needs: General Electric, Toyota, Hershey, Caterpillar, Berry Global, and more. For more information about us, visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

We believe in providing our clients with the specific solutions to their problems. We’re shipping large, complex industrial mobile robotics platforms that require a skilled integrator to troubleshoot, repair and maintain them in the field.

 

As a Field Services Technician, you will be responsible for all things hardware.  You will provide on-site and remote advanced repair and troubleshooting, provide repair and maintenance training to customers, generate repair and maintenance procedures and manuals and trial new retrofits and recalls.

Your goal is to efficiently return customer systems to operation and minimize downtime experienced.

You will receive support from the rest of the OTTO Motors production, engineering, and operations teams to ensure that your work is streamlined. You will also provide feedback to the team regarding cost and complexity as necessary. 

  • Support and repair existing customer deployments (requires traveling to customer location)
  • Audit systems to verify optimal functionality (hardware preventative maintenance, network audits, user interactions, etc.)
  • Provide clear and concise feedback to internal teams to continually improve our products and focus our offerings.
  • Review customer workflow, software and database systems


About You

You want to work for a fast-paced growing company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with less than 100% effort. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. You look forward to traveling around the globe, expanding Clearpath and OTTO Motors’ robot domain.

You like the thought of working on projects that interact with the world, even more so when they can do so on their own. You\'re looking for a job where you get to interact with a diverse team and learn something new every day. You like tackling new problems and learning as you go.

You are comfortable working remotely, interfacing with your company and customers via web conferencing, phone, IM and e-mail communication.

You are a self-starter.  You do not need to be micro-managed and are looking to be given goals and tasks that you will follow through to completion on your own while providing feedback and updates on status.

Required Experience/Skills:

  • Exceptional professionalism and client-facing skills (frequent interaction with customers required)
  • Excellent problem solving skills
  • Electrical system debugging and repair
  • Mechanical aptitude and experience working with your hands
  • Software system integration and system debugging
  • Computer networking and applicable industrial standards
  • Detail oriented, excellent written and verbal communication

Bonus points for:

  • Linux (Ubuntu)
  • ROS
  • C, C++, Python
  • Comptia, A+
  • Comptia Network+
  • Experience troubleshooting Networking and Wireless issues
  • Experience working with complex linked systems

*Candidate must be able to travel to US immediately so should have a valid visa or residency status.

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.description:
Description

Education:        Diploma/Degree in a related field

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

We are currently selling more robots than we can build! We require an organized individual to assist with inspection of a variety of made to spec. components, to assist with analysis on issued MTS/OTS parts and to communicate solutions to all vested parties. We need a Quality Analyst to take responsibility in ensuring our core products are built with components of the utmost quality as well as ensuring our core products are capable of handling specified end-user requirements. You will be a part of our Quality team helping us make sure that Clearpath robots can handle the world’s dullest, dirtiest and deadliest jobs for many years.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Incoming quality inspection of made to spec.parts

Additional tasks may include:

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied doing a job less than 100%. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

Required Technical Skills:

  • Ability to read a schematic, identify mechanical/electrical components and determine root cause of PCB or robot test failures
  • Practical understanding of mechanical/electrical defects
  • Practical understanding of cable assembly, PCBA quality standards and common defects
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office Excel and Word, Google Sheets and Docs.

Bonus points for:

  • Any of IPC-7711, IPC-7721, IPC-A-600, IPC-9121, IPC-610 training or equivalent

item.title: Senior Project Manager
item.description:
Description

Position:              Senior Project Manager           
Location:             Kitchener, ON
Job Type:             Full Time Permanent           
Experience:         7+Years relevant experience
Education:           BS or MSc Degree in Engineering, or similar technical field in an Engineering discipline
Division:               OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.


About the Job

We are shipping more and more robots and are taking on bigger and better contracts. We are delivering more and more integrated solutions, including operational and support services through Managed Services approaches. We need someone to help our existing project management team to take our Managed Services projects from original concept through to final implementation, and subsequently ongoing operations and maintenance support to achieve customer operational performance guarantees.

As a Project Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing and coordinating project deliverables and serving as the point of contact between customers, subcontractors and internal departments. Your goal is to manage the efforts of team members and vendors to ensure our projects are delivered on time and ensuring our customers’ needs are met at go live and throughout the operational use of or solutions.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Responsible for identifying project scope, assign individual responsibilities, identify resources needed, and develop a schedule to ensure timely completion of project and delivery.
  • Lead, organize, manage and motivate the project team and develop effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Act as the primary interface with Customer project as well as operations management; build close cooperative relationships with Customers, focused on long term partnerships.
  • Manage subcontractors and vendors to ensure on time delivery in line with agreed scope of work within agreed budget.
  • Ensure management of the operational steady state phase of our solutions at our Customer to ensure our customers business objectives and service levels are achieved, including management of operational escalations.
  • Develop detailed work plans, schedules, project estimates, resource plans, and status reports.
  • Conduct project meetings and take responsibility for project tracking and analysis.
  • Responsible for and manage cost, cashflow, schedule, scope and risk management. Responsible for overall profit of project as well as customer satisfaction.
  • Act as the point person for changes, updates, questions, and issues. Identify and pursue opportunities
  • Identify and communicate vital information to the design team and the company
  • Shape and impact processes; 
  • Think ahead to raise and examine problems and propose possible solutions

 About You

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done.  You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

As our next Senior Project Manager, you know how to under promise and over deliver, adapt to changing directions, priorities and personalities, and be a world-class juggler… with projects and deadlines that is.  You have exceptional project and contract management experience from previous work placements. You have the experience and ability to manage to ensure our solutions, once delivered, are operating and being maintained in a way that ensures business continuity and performance of customer mission critical automated processes.

Required Experience/Skills:

  • BS or MSc Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or similar technical field  in an Engineering discipline. Additional education in business administration, finance, operations, or project management an asset.
  • 10+ years of project management experience in a dynamic environment with multi-disciplined technical team members, demonstrating increasing levels of project value and complexity in automated material handling industry
  • Experience managing complex groups of stakeholders, including large customer organizations as well as subcontractors and vendors. 
  • Leadership capability to create and manage a unified and motivated project team
  • Unusually strong organizational and time-management skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks at once, while still paying attention to detail
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Project and other project management tools
  • A strong work ethic and self-starter attitude, with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent verbal and written communication, with the ability to build long term relationships/partnerships
  • Drive for continuous improvement

Bonus Points For:

  • Mechatronics background and experience with Automated Controls Systems. 
  • Optional: Engineering Technologist degree.
  • Experience within field of automated material handling. 
  • Experience in managing operations and maintenance of mission critical manufacturing or material handling environments with mechanical, electrical, software and IT components.
  • PMP certification/accreditation
  • Experience with RaaS, BPO or managed services type of contracts.
  • Proficiency in Epicor
  • 1-2 years of engineering design experience
  • knowledge of contract law, along with negotiation skills
  • Willing and able to travel internationally (especially US).
